section.title: Create and manage databases
section.para: The Database service provides scalable and reliable cloud provisioning functionality for both relational and non-relational database engines. Users can quickly and easily use database features without the burden of handling complex administrative tasks.

formalpara.title: Prerequisites
formalpara.para: Before you create a database instance, you need to configure a default datastore and make sure you have an appropriate flavor for the type of database instance you want.

step.title: Configure a default datastore.
step.para: Because the dashboard does not let you choose a specific datastore to use with an instance, you need to configure a default datastore. The dashboard then uses the default datastore to create the instance.

Replace DATASTORE_NAME with the name that the administrative user set when issuing the trove-manage command to create the datastore. You can use the trove datastore-list command to display the datastores that are available in your environment.

step.title: Verify flavor.
step.para: Make sure an appropriate flavor exists for the type of database instance you want.

formalpara.title: Create database instance
formalpara.para: Once you have configured a default datastore and verified that you have an appropriate flavor, you can create a database instance.

step.para: Log in to the dashboard, choose a project, and click Databases.
Click Database Instances. This lists the instances that already exist in your environment.
In the Launch Database dialog box, specify the following values.

td.para: Specify a name for the database instance.
Select an appropriate flavor for the instance.
Select a volume size. Volume size is expressed in GB.
Optionally provide a comma separated list of databases to create, for example:
Create an initial admin user. This user will have access to all the databases you create.
Specify a password associated with the initial admin user you just named.
Optionally, allow the user to connect only from this host. If you do not specify a host, this user will be allowed to connect from anywhere.

step.para: Click the Launch button. The new database instance appears in the databases list.
